subtasks: Lift a hoe.
Carry the hoe over the shoulder.
Use the hoe to dig the ground.
Move the broken-off weeds and roots.
Climb into a hay rack.
Balance the hay rack with arms and legs to position it appropriately.
Climb down from the hay rack.

tasks.task: Load hay bale into the hay rack.
subtasks: Grasp and lift a hay bale.
Position the hay bale into the hay rack.

tasks.task: Unload hay bales from the hay rack.
subtasks: Disengage the hay bale from the hay rack.
Lift the hay bale from the hay rack.
Place the hay bale down.

tasks.task: Participate in farm social event activities.
subtasks: Walk along the aisle of the barn.
Sit on a hay bale with standing farm members.
Engage in conversation with other farmers.
Take part in handing out hay feed.

tasks.task: Pass hay bales to agricultural workers.
subtasks: Hold a hay bale ready for another person.
Coordinate timing of releasing the hay bale to the agricultural worker.

tasks.task: Drive or maneuver a single-axle trailer.
subtasks: Operate the brakes to stop the trailer.
Position the trailer in relation to the barn.
Connect the trailer to a horse or other draft animal.

tasks.task: Flick or slap at flies with a hat.
subtasks: Move the hat to face the direction of the flies.
Rotate the hat to strike at the flies.
Tack up the horse (preparation for riding).
Secure the saddle on the horse.
Apply stirrups on the horse.
Mount the horse.
Steer the horse along a path (such as through the field).
Dismount the horse safely.

tasks.task: Adjust or ride in a hay wagon.
subtasks: Check if seat is secure before sitting.
Sit balance on the unpadded hay wagon.
Instruct the horse to go forward with reins.
Request the horse to turn or stop with reins.

tasks.task: Assist in the handling and moving of a large object like a hay bale.
subtasks: Approach the hay bale to assess its position.
Move the hay bale to a desired location.
Position the hay bale against support (e.g., wall or stack).

tasks.task: Garden or till in areas of the field.
subtasks: Approach the garden or till area.
Kneel down to access the ground level.
Use a shovel or similar tool to dig in the soil.
Stand up, potentially feeling the impact or strain on the legs.
Repeat till or garden tasks as needed.

tasks.task: Participate in barn activities, such as checking on equipment or socializing.
subtasks: Walk inside the barn.
Observe or check machinery that is stored.
Engage with other farm workers or visitors in a social setting.
Exchange information or help about farming practices or equipment.
